title: List of all Androidmy  app  libraries for use in your project
meta: See collection of all Androidmy  app  libraries, filter by license, modified date, languages, and select best for your usecase.

repoList.name: Android-Five-Stars-Library
repoList.description: Android Five Stars Library is a small library that helps developer add a "Rate My App" dialog to their applications. It's called "Five Stars" because the dialog has a different behaviour based on the rating given by the user.

repoList.name: myonnaise
repoList.description: 🍯 A RxJava library to access Raw EMG data from your Myo 📈 (plus an Android companion App 📱)

repoList.name: MyHouseAdsAndroid
repoList.description: A library for cross promoting own apps within own apps - for Android

repoList.name: Doppler-Android-Demo
repoList.description: Demo app for my doppler library for android

repoList.name: AppFloater
repoList.description: An Android app that creates an 'always on top' floating icon for any installed application. Similar to the Facebook app chat heads. Makes use of my Floater library.

repoList.name: MyNDKLibApp
repoList.description: Tutorial to create a CMake based Android Studio NDK shared library and application.

repoList.name: android-web-scraping-app-jsoup
repoList.description: Sometimes we need to scrap web data from our Android App. To achieve this goal jsoup library is a good option. I wrote a blog post on this topic in my personal blog. If you know Bengali language then you can visit this link.

repoList.name: gplay-batchtool
repoList.description: Automatically remove all entries from Google Play > My Apps & Games > Library

repoList.name: netlib
repoList.description: Android network support library used in several of my apps.

repoList.name: MyLibrary_Android_Application
repoList.description: This is an Android application which allows the user to manage his personal library. The goal is to be able to look for books information thanks to the Google Book API and then be able to add this book to our personal library on this app. Then the user can update an added books to put his personal rate, and his own point a view about it for example. I'm using Google Sign in API to connect to the app, Google Book API to find information about a book entered by the user, Retrofit to deal with the JSON file sent by the API and I use a SQLite database
